subject: Music
title: Music and Parkinson's Disease
description: A quick, practical guide to Music and Parkinson's Disease.

hook.text: A person with Parkinson's who can barely walk can often dance to music perfectly.

buildup.text: Parkinson's damages the basal ganglia â€” disrupting the internal timing system.

discovery.text: External rhythm from music bypasses the damaged circuits and provides alternative timing.

twist.text: Rhythmic auditory stimulation improves gait speed and stride length in clinical trials.

climax.text: Patients walk more steadily with rhythmic cues than with any verbal instruction.

punchline.text: When the brain's clock breaks, music becomes the new timekeeper.

quiz.question: How does music help Parkinson's patients walk?
options: External rhythm bypasses damaged timing circuits
